text:
Bern is a city in Nemaha County, Kansas, United States. In 2010, 166 people lived there.
History.
Bern had started in the late 1880s when a railroad was built through that territory. It was named by Swiss immigrants after Bern, the capital of Switzerland.
Geography.
The United States Census Bureau says that the city has a total area of. All of it is land.
2010 census.
The 2010 census says that there were 166 people, 81 households, and 45 families living in Bern.
